headline: Roast Sticky Chicken-Rotisserie Style
description: Rotisserie chicken seasoning is a simple homemade spice rub made with basic pantry spices used to make flavorful baked rotisserie chicken at home.

video.description: This chicken is so easy to prepare, so incredibly delicious to eat.
video.name: Roast Sticky Chicken Rotisserie Style

name: Roast Sticky Chicken-Rotisserie Style

recipeInstructions.text: Mix together salt, paprika, onion powder, thyme, white pepper, black pepper, cayenne pepper, and garlic powder in a small bowl; set aside.

Remove and discard giblets from chicken. Rinse chicken cavity; pat dry with paper towels. Rub each chicken inside and out with spice mixture. Place 1 onion into the cavity of each chicken. Place chickens in resealable plastic bags or double wrap with plastic wrap. Refrigerate overnight, or at least 4 to 6 hours.
Preheat the oven to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C).
Place chickens in a roasting pan.
Bake uncovered until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the meat near the bone reads at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C), about 5 hours. Let chickens rest for 10 minutes before carving.

review.reviewBody: Made this using 5 and 6 pound chickens. Mostly followed the recipe, omitting white pepper because I didn’t have any. Stuffed the cavities with onion , garlic cloves and celery and cooked breast down in an aluminum roaster pan. 5 hours at 250 was just perfect for what I had. Oh my goodness, did this turn out wonderfully! Fell right off the bone with amazing flavor. There was plenty for dinner and lots left over to freeze for future meals as it’s just me and hubby. Got almost a quart of super rich broth that I froze as well. This is definitely a plan-ahead dish but well worth it!
This taste like the amazing store bought rotisserie chicken! I have made it a few times now and I always make a double batch of the spice mixture to keep on hand! Our family lives it!
I've been making this chicken for a few years now and it's always a pleaser and easy to make. I love this recipe!
It is a family favorite and I am making it tonight for dinner. I have been making this chicken for decades!
great recipe i made it at work. Thanks
This is the best chicken ever! It is the only way I fix it anymore and I follow the recipe exactly. I also use both carcasses to make broth for my chicken and dumplings....sooooo good!
So good! Putting the dry rub on the chicken the night before, seal it in the fridge, and cook it the next day. Yummm!
Loved it, use this recipe all the time
This coating was great! I left out the Cayenne pepper but added rosemary flakes. My husband couldn't stop raving about it!
Family requests this!!’ Love it.

The first time I made this with a 4 lb chicken it was a bit dry. Excellent flavor but a bit overdone. I tried it again with a 6 1/2 lb roaster and it was chicken perfection. Incredibly tender and juicy. The gravy was delicious and I have the carcass tucked away in the freezer for future chicken stock. My next purchase is a good wireless meat thermometer so I can keep an eye on the temp of smaller chickens

This recipe is fantastic - definitely restaurant quality. I love to use it in my Showtime rotisserie for either whole chickens or chicken parts (done in the basket). Amazing recipe as written - I wouldn’t change a thing!
The skin was very dry and crewy. This need a second look and try.

I tried to make this exactly as the recipe directed and don't think I deviated at all. It didn't turn out quite as "sticky" as it looks in the picture, but it was very good, tender and a little bit spicy. Will make again.

BEST roasted chicken ever!!!!!! I have made 1 chicken and used the seasonings in the recipe for the 1 chicken but if I make 2, I double it. I add baby carrots and potatoes. I cooked it at 350’. SO DELICIOUS!
It's worth the time! Delicious!

This is a fabulous Roast Chicken Recipe! I have made this about a dozen times. Makes great leftovers. I have on occasion deviated from the spices ie 'a lemon pepper chicken' or upping a spice, or leaving out a spice, but the posted spice combinations is still the winner and well worth sticking to it. (no pun intended). At the end of the cook time, I switch to broil, on high, and watch it till the skin on the ckicken begins to smoke and then I pull it out with nice brown crispy skin.
Perfectly juicy every time!

This rotisserie-style chicken is everything you want it to be and it's a breeze! All you need is some planning as it does take time. 
Making it for the second time. Thank you for sharing. It's a keeper.

I thought I'd give this a go, as I've never cooked it at a such low temp. Followed the recipe to the T but the flavour was mediocre, meat was too soft to the point it was mushy and not worth its time.

I’ve had this saved for years! I use one chicken, although using 2 would be great for meal prepping for another meal in the week. I also swear there were instructions to slide butter pats under the skin, but maybe I’m thinking of another recipe and combining them. This spice blend is what I use, and have been flexible with what spices I’m missing, and it still turns out great, every time.

I almost always modify every recipe. I didn’t touch this one and it was stellar!!! I modified the cook time because I used an heirloom chicken that was kinda small. That’s it. I did baste once half way through with the drippings. Even the leftover chicken was awesome the next day. Make this!

By far our favorite way of roasting a whole chicken. The seasoning is phenomenal. Also for some extra flavor I have put it on the grill for at around 425 for a bit around 425 for about 20 - 30 mins then put it in the oven to finish.
I've made this over 50 times....but just a tip, I had my husband pop it in the oven and he placed it breast side down and it was MUCH more succulent white meat. Happy accident there.
Absolutely Perfect! Dont change a thing. If you absolutely must- maybe a little less salt.
3.75 lb chicken took four hours. One of the best chickens we ever ate!
My favorite roast chicken recipe since 2008!
I have made this so many times and we love it!

This was one great recipe! I tricked out by actually using a rotisserie with birch chips for a bit of smoke. I also made a baste of 3:1 butter and reserved bacon drippings and the seasonings used in this recipe.

ok .. saw this recipe thought it looked super good and was worth giving a shot. boy am I glad I did. this is the most amazing chicken I have ever had, store bought rotisserie included. the seasoning is perfect and it came out so juicy and tender. I did baste it about every 45 minutes or so to prevent the skin from getting crisp and to keep it moist. mine took about an hour longer than the recipe states because I opted for one larger chicken rather than two smaller ones. I also didn't have the white pepper, thyme or cayenne. next time I will probably see how it is with those but I think it was incredible without. also the drippings make the most flavorful gravy, seriously it's amazing. 
Side note: the recipe doesn't state this, I'm sure most people making this recipe already know but some may not, make sure you put about an inch of water in your roasting pan because otherwise your chicken is going to dry out. and I definitely recommend basting.

I did the one chicken, used the same spices. I didn't have an onion so I used carrots and celery in place of the onion. Baked it in the crockpot on low heat for 8 hours. It was SO tender and delicious! This one is a keeper!

I've been coming to this recipe for years to make the seasoning, but I always cut down on the salt. I use it for all my meats. today I finally roasted a whole chicken. this chicken is mig sticky but very yummy.

Followed recipe exactly including overnight in fridge to let spices absorb. Chicken was amazing but not enough flavor. Next time will also increase spices and add under the skin before wrapping and resting. Definitely the best way to cook chicken...low and slow

OMG—-must tell you, this is not the first time I have followed this recipe for seasonings for rotisserie chicken but we just finished dinner, and it was out of this world!!! Yes—-probably the best we have ever had. So moist and flavorful, we were just consuming it like there is no tomorrow!!! Didn’t use the onions inside, just put the chicken in the rotisserie and sprinkle the seasoning mixture on it as it turned around in the oven. Hope you take the time to make this for dinner and enjoy it as much as we did!

Time for me to leave a review. I've been making this recipe everytime I have a chicken to roast. I must put my rub on heavy because I wind up doubling the spices everytime. The chicken is delicious and moist everytime. I start taking the temperature every 10 minutes after the 4 hour mark. I've never gone the full five hours, but I have a gas oven. When I take the chicken out we all stand around and pick the skin off and eat it. So crispy, so tasty

Absolutely delicious! Meat was falling off the bone and so so juicy. My 5 year-old could not get enough. We are one chicken for dinner and then shredded the second to make chicken enchiladas and chicken tostadas. The seasoning was perfect too. May add some garlic to the cavity as well as the onion next time. Yum!

So easy and perfect for busy people who want to eat fresh delicious food! I love this recipe and so does my family!! like a lot of other reviewers, I made this seasoning in a big batch so I can quickly prep and throw the chicken in the fridge the night before I want to cook it, then throw it in the oven a few hours before serving dinner. Over the next couple days after making 1 chicken, we still have plenty left over to use in tacos, enchiladas, chicken salad, so many possibilities and very little effort/time needed. Also cost effective! In my area, while chickens are about $1 a pound.

Delicious! I used two young chickens, both were a little over 5lbs. Make sure you pat the chicken dry if you want crispy skin. I made the recipe exactly as written only I separated the skin from the breast and shoved tabs of butter between the skin and the meat. Doing this helps breast meat stay moist, I do it whenever I roast a turkey too. Sometimes I use a seasoned butter mixture for added flavor...anyways, then I liberally sprinkled my seasoning mixture all over my birds, shoved some onions inside them and put them in my fridge for like 5 hours...then into my oven uncovered at 250...4-5 hours later and BAM, delicious super moist flavorful chicken. I’m happy I kept the cayenne pepper the same.. it just gave it the slightest heat without really being noticeable. YUM.

Best whole chicken I ever made. I did rub butter on the chicken before the rub, and a little under the breast skin, basted at hour 2, 3 and 4. My bird was a little under 4lb, so took it out after 4 hr. 45 minutes, let it rest under a foil tent. Made gravy from the pan drippings, delicious!
It was very easy and it tasted just like the supermarkets but much better

After reading the reviews I added some lemon and garlic in with the onions and let it marinate overnight. I think that’s the trick, the more it marinades the juicier it turns out! Pretty standard rotisserie chicken recipe so as I use I’m sure I’ll tweak more to get the taste just right!
Super awesome! The only thing I would change is to reduce salt.
love it
Too much work and oven use for chicken. I think I could get close by baking it the regular way.

I added some orange slices, celery and onions to the cavity in addition to the spice rub and it was a huge hit with my family. 
This was so moist and delicious my sister raved about it for days.
Still great for a weekend plan-ahead meal. My crowd loves it. Thanks. Great recipe.
Made this and is was really good. The meat just fell off the bones. Well cooked and juicy. I cooked this in my Nesco and put potatoes in with the chicken.
I did not change anything and it was moist and delicious!

I place this in the slow cooker on thick sliced onions. Also place onion and 1/4 to1/2 Apple inside. Place on high for six hours check temperature of chicken then continue for 1 - 2 more hours. You will have a lot of juice from the chicken, you may remove the juice, with a baster or continue cooking in r

This was super easy and super good. It smelled wonderful cooking and the chicken breast was melt in your mouth tender. The only change I made was to use snoked paprika instead of regular. Thanks for the great recipe.
I added pieces of butter to the cavity and to the breast. Basted frequently. Beautifully golden and delicious!
This is a go-to staple in my household who 3 small children who hate anything chicken! It's AMAZING!
Thought it sucked. Did everything according to directions. Spices were bland, slow cooking did nothing. Best to stick to my own intuition.
This is a very versatile rub. I have made it a few times now and scale the recipe to make a large batch to keep handy in an airtight container. Thanks for the great recipe!
Loved. Most moist chicken I've ever cooked. And to the guy who says he may as well go buy a rotisserie chicken to save on time, sure you can do that, if you don't love to cook.

Hi there, I made this last night and I was impressed by the results. It was flavorful, moist and the skin was crispy. I see some reviews were saying 5 hours is too long but for me it was accurate and I was cooking one chicken. I also was checking the temperature after 2 1/2 hours and then again around 4 hours. So each person's oven varies and you do what is best for your oven. Use the 5 hours as a gage as to how long you should roast it in the oven. And I am glad to see I can rotisserie a chicken when I want to. Thank you.
No changes; absolutely amazing.
No changes; absolutely amazing.
The spices used in this recipe were perfect. The only thing I didn't use was the cayenne, because I am a super wuss.

Made it exactly as described. Fantastic, moist, flavorful. My oven has a probe attachment, which I set to 170F. Good thing I did because I fell asleep right as I put the chickens in the oven. Woke up 3.25 hours later and the oven had just shut off and the chickens were done absolutely perfectly. So glad I didn’t leave them roasting for 5 hours. This one’s a keeper.

Buying a store bought rotisserie chicken is probably cheaper and easier. but this was good!: I would cut the salt next time. i used my oven thermometer probe and my chickens were at 180 degrees in 3.5 hours! 5 hours would've been a disaster. Both chickens were perfectly roasted and very moist. I shred one chicken and froze the shredded meat for future meals. Served with some roasted root veggies and it was a very nice dinner on a cold night!

So stinkin yummy!! My family absolutely loved it! I did make alterations- I took the advice to leave out white pepper, half the cayenne and paprika (I have a kid that doesn’t like too much spice), and do a full tsp of garlic powder. I also did chicken breast instead and marinated everything with a can of chicken broth over night. Baked the breasts at 350* for 30 minutes. I will definitely be making this again and again and again!

this is an absolutely amazing recipe! I follow it exactly aside from making more dry rub than the recipe calls for so I can use it all the time! make sure not to skip the overnight marinating and stuffing the onion in. In a pinch once i roasted the bird without letting it sit overnight and it wasnt nearly as good and flavorful. the drippings from this make the best gravy, I use the fat to make a rue then add the juice topped up to 2 cups and a splash of wine. soooooo good! thanks for this recipe. it's a staple in our fall/winter meals.
This chicken is fabulous! I'm a real lover of rotiserrie chicken but it unavailable where I live. This is a great substitute.
Tried this. Skin was rubbery. Tasted great though. Just needs to be baked at higher temperature.

I made this today and cooked the chicken on the rotisserie setting of my air fryer oven. It was amazing! I didn't have time to let it sit but the skin was still super crispy and had great flavor. Will use less salt next time if unable to set in fridge for a while. Thank for the recipe!!
This is the best way to make an at home rotisserie chicken.

I have made this several times before as written but wasn't quite satisfied with it, the skin always seemed dry without being really crispy. Today I put a few pats of cold butter under the skin and basted it with the pan juices. A definite improvement, although I've yet to think its anything like rotisserie chicken. I will continue to make it again, but I think I'll try some sage in place of some of the thyme. Also, I made a gravy from pan drippings. Those drippings have a lot of good flavoring.

I used an actual rotisserie for this recipe, modifying it so that I had plenty of leftover to baste the chicken -- just in case. Starting off on high heat for 10 minutes, I turned the grill burners to low, put an aluminum foil "boat" to catch the juices. I let it go 2 hours like this until the internal temp hit between 160 and 180.

The chicken was pull apart tender, though strictly speaking, that was the result of a 4 hour brine; no-brine=dry chicken; brine=incredibly juicy chicken. But I liked this recipe. I'll try it again with a few minor modifications to suit my own tastes.

It looks and smells amazing! I'm so glad to have this recipe. I never feel completely comfortable with the precooked ones from the store since I don't know what all they put in them. They are easy but, I really don't like preservatives and additional chemicals. I can't wait to taste this version! It is very easy to make!
Ceñí

I used this recipe for seasoning and it was really good. 
With my chicken already brine overnight, I was looking for something other than salt and pepper and found this recipe. It was delicious. I cut half the salt (cus the brine) the rest stayed the same except I used smoked paprika and into the Ronco it went.

Excellent!! 1almost 5lb chicken was done in 3 1/2 hrs. So moist, flavorful and juicy. Saved the broth for the Pork Medallion from this site as recommended. Can't wait to make again! Thanks for the wonderful recipe!
it was good, don't get me wrong; but it was very like a typical rotisserie chicken. if that's what you're looking for, it's a winner. but i'd just as soon as pick one up at the grocery.
wonderful chicken. I made a gravy from the juices and it was outstanding
I love this chicken! Turns out perfect every time, although I cook it 5 1/2 - 6 hrs.
Loved this!! Only two of us,so halved the recipe for one chicken and it’s soooo tasty. I like the idea of premaking the seasoning, but struggled with how much to use at a time/chicken.

I followed the recipe exactly except I added minced garlic. The chicken was very juicy when I cut into it and the meat was juicy, tender and literally fell off the bone. Not exactly rotisserie chicken as the skin was very dry, but we peeled it off and tossed it anyhow. Like one reviewer said she added minced garlic, I did also, to the inside cavity and also all over the outside because we love garlic. Overall the flavor was good and the meat was juicy and fall apart tender. Just wish the skin wasn’t so dry and tough.
Delicious chicken. I adjust the cooking time depending on the size of the bird I get. Sometimes I will mince a couple of garlic cloves and throw them in with the onions.

This is the EXACT rub recipe I use on my rotisserie chicken. I typically use my rotisserie for this (although I do not season and wrap for a couple of hrs). I, too, like many, don't use the white pepper as I don't keep on hand. Today, I go low and slow in the oven as I am making two larger birds. Cannot wait to eat. Never received a negative comment. Perfect.

Wonderful flavor and tenderness. Didn’t take the full five hours to reach 180 degrees so advise always use a thermometer. I always sprinkle Wondra in roasting pans and add the stick off giblets to make great gravy. Will definitely add to cool weather cooking list.

Excellent! I took Maria P. Black's suggestion and increased the serving size to 48 (ignore the onion and chicken quantiies). That gave perfect rounded cups and tablespoon sizes and resulted in just under a cup and a half of seasoning; probably enough to cook at least eight chickens.

Have to be honest...I wasn't expecting much..just trying to find a half decent roast chicken recipe. I didn't have time to marinade. It really didn't matter. Shoved the onion and some garlic cloves into the chicken. Used the spice to give it a good COMPLETE rub covering. Slow roast at 250. Wow!!! This was great. Nice and crispy and flavorful. Cooked breast side up until the last hour. Emptied most of the juice for gravy and turned over. Be careful of over cooking . Also I didn't need to use all the seasoning to get a good coating. Definitely a MAKE AGAIN!!
My wife said it was the best chicken she has ever tasted! Next time I will cook two chickens for sure. Thank you Sue Rogers

Made this following recipe to the letter. I made a double batch of dry rub (only made one chicken) and applied it inside, outside and even under the breast skin. Marinated 20 hours in the fridge prior to cooking. Chicken only took 4 hours to reach proper temperature. Let it rest 1/2 hour while I made mashed potatoes to go with it. The chicken texture was fine, but the flavor was so bland, it was like I had never marinated it at all. Pretty disappointed. P.S. It tasted nothing like rotisserie chicken.
followed recipie to a T...I did give it 15 mins at 400 to make it extra crispy...best ever chicken!

I followed the directions as written. After three hours, I sliced into the chicken to see if it was cooked and it was still pink in the center. It took another hour to cook fully. Afterward, it was dry and all the flavor was in the skin. It didn’t fall off the bone as other reviewers stated, and it tasted nothing like rotisserie chicken, not even close. If I ever make this again, I’ll put it in the slow cooker instead. But I’m much more likely to just buy a rotisserie chicken.
This chicken was pretty bland and turned out extremely dry. Perhaps my oven is not calibrated correctly, but I think if I took it out after 3 1/2 - 4 hours it would have been better.

excellent chicken recipe. made as what the recipe called for. no tweeks. When done i cut the chicken into pieces and let the white meat just bast in the pan with the seasoned juices. There was no plain meat flavor .The leftovers, i stored in vaccum sealed bags and placed in freezer for later use for chicken pot pie or chicken noodle soup.
I used to have a recipe called "Mimi's Sticky Chicken" that was this, but just with one chicken instead of two. It's delicious.
Great recipe made exactly as written. Be sure not to skip the step of allowing the chicken to absorb the rub in the refrigerator overnight. This is an excellent no fail recipe.

Great seasoning blend, however, I omitted the white pepper and used extra black pepper in its place. I also covered the chicken with foil and baked at 325 degrees. The last 25 minutes of cooking I removed the foil and upped the temp to 425 for a golden brown finish-perfection!
I make this recipe exactly as it is written. Once in a while I use all chicken breasts. I let the spices sit on the chicken usually about 24 hours. Perfect.

First, and most important, you do not cook poultry for a set amount of time, you cook until an internal temperature is reached. With this recipe, 180 degrees fahrenheit. I have used an inexpensive Acurite model 00993ST for years. $25.00. Or, google "Best digital meat thermometers" and pick your own. Second, your oven temperature. I would make a bet I think is safe that most ovens are not within 20 degrees of what you set it at. I used my Thermoworks IR-GUN-S laser infrared thermometer to check my oven.($33.00) A word about oven thermometers. The mercury bulb type are almost impossible to read. The round bi-metal stripe type are wildly inaccurate. Put an empty small ceramic dish, like a ramekin, in the oven, and put on 250 degrees. Aim the laser on it. Mine settled on 220 . So I had to set it on 280 in order to get 250. (As you can probably tell by now, I take my cooking very seriously) For my 4+ pound chicken, it took 3hrs 45min to come to 180 degrees. NOT 5 hours. It turned out great, but would have been like shoe leather after 5 hours.

I have learned over the years to treat recipes as inspirational guidelines, not gospel. Happy Cooking.
Hot hot hot, I should have reduced the cayenne by at least half. Too salt
Just like a rotisserie chicken! Juicy, tender and something different to do with chicken.

I've made this many times, it's always great! I've even made it with turkey and it came out great! I do a couple of additions. I add onions in the cavity along with the celery. I carefully separate the skin from the breast using fingers flat against the breast. I spread 1/4 cup of softened butter or margarine in-between the skin and the meat, carefully making sure the skin doesn't tear. This makes the white meat on the breast extra tender and tasty. Everyone loves it every time!
New family favorite.
Perfect!!!!
